summary: Mohenjo-daro is an ancient city located in Pakistan, built around 2500 BCE. It was one of the largest settlements of the Indus Valley Civilization and one of the world's earliest major cities. With a population of at least 40,000, it thrived for many years but was abandoned by around 1700 BCE. Rediscovered in the 1920s, it became a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1980. Today, the site faces threats from erosion and poor restoration efforts.
title: Mohenjo-daro
